meanings.definition: To make a sharp, ringing sound, as of a plucked string.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys twanging the guitar strings in her free time.
meanings.sent2: The musician was twanging the strings of his banjo during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally knocked over the guitar, causing it to start twanging loudly.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled through the night, twanging the branches of the trees like a symphony.
meanings.sent5: The sound of twanging strings filled the room, creating a lively atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A sharp, ringing sound, as of a plucked string.
meanings.sent1: The twanging of the guitar strings echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the twanging of the harp from across the hall.
meanings.sent3: The sudden twanging noise made everyone jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The twanging of the strings seemed to dance in the air, creating a magical aura.
meanings.sent5: The twanging of the banjo added a unique charm to the music performance.
